content:
ToolStripOverflowButton Class

Definition

Hosts a ToolStripDropDown that displays items that overflow the ToolStrip.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability(System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability.None)]
public class ToolStripOverflowButton : System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton

Remarks

If there are more overflow items than can be displayed on the form, use the ToolStrip Items Collection Editor to manage this situation.

Properties

DefaultMargin

Gets the space, in pixels, that is specified by default between controls.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.Padding DefaultMargin { get; }
Value
Padding

A Padding value representing the space between controls.

HasDropDownItems

Gets a value indicating whether the ToolStripOverflowButton has items that overflow the ToolStrip.

public override bool HasDropDownItems { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the ToolStripOverflowButton has overflow items; otherwise, false.

RightToLeftAutoMirrorImage

This property is not relevant to this class.

public bool RightToLeftAutoMirrorImage { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to enable automatic mirroring; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is not relevant to this class.

Methods

CreateAccessibilityInstance()

Creates a new accessibility object for the control.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject CreateAccessibilityInstance ();
Returns
AccessibleObject

A new AccessibleObject for the control.

Remarks

If you do not explicitly call the CreateAccessibilityInstance method, it will be called when the AccessibilityObject property is referenced.

Note

To get or set the AccessibilityObject property, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.

CreateDefaultDropDown()

Creates an empty ToolStripDropDown that can be dropped down and to which events can be attached.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown CreateDefaultDropDown ();
Returns
ToolStripDropDown

A ToolStripDropDown control.

Dispose(Boolean)

Called by the stem.ComponentModel.Component.Dispose* and stem.ComponentModel.Component.Finalize* methods to release the managed and unmanaged resources used by the current instance of the ToolStripOverflowButton class.

protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
disposing
Boolean

true to release managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

Remarks

This method is called only by the public Dispose and Finalize methods; do not call this method directly. When you implement the dispose pattern, the Boolean parameter of the Dispose method should be used as follows:

  • The Dispose() method of the current object should call Dispose with the Boolean parameter set to true to release both managed and unmanaged resources.

  • The Finalize method of the current object should call Dispose with the Boolean parameter set to false to release only unmanaged resources.

    For more information, see Implementing a Dispose Method.

GetPreferredSize(Size)

Retrieves the size of a rectangular area into which a control can fit.

public override System.Drawing.Size GetPreferredSize (System.Drawing.Size constrainingSize);
constrainingSize
Size

The custom-sized area for a control.

Returns
Size

An ordered pair of type Size representing the width and height of a rectangle.

OnPaint(PaintEventArgs)

Raises the Paint event.

protected override void OnPaint (System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs e);
e
PaintEventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnPaint method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

SetBounds(Rectangle)

Sets the size and location of the ToolStripOverflowButton.

protected override void SetBounds (System.Drawing.Rectangle bounds);
bounds
Rectangle

A Rectangle representing the size and location of the ToolStripOverflowButton.
